Package com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces

Interface IController

  • public interface IController
    A controller is the piece of software that deals with the physical world.

    A controller, can be written in any programming language: Java, C, Python, JavaScript, ...

    Note: OOP Polymorphism is avoided here in method names because some languages (like JS) do not allow it.
    Author:
    Francisco Jos√© Morero Peyrona Official web site at: https://github.com/peyrona/mingle

    • Method Detail

      • set

        void set​(java.lang.String deviceName,
         java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> deviceInit,
         IController.Listener listener)
        Sets the device that will be managed by this controller.

        There is no advantage in being the configuration a JSON string because there is no guarantee that native controllers will accept a JSON encoded in a string, neither that the [key,value] pairs will be those that the native driver is expecting.

        Parameters:
        deviceName - Device name.
        deviceInit - Device configuration as propName, propValue pairs (it can be null).
        listener -

      • getDeviceName

        java.lang.String getDeviceName()
        Returns the associated device name.
        Returns:
        The associated device name.

      • getDeviceConfig

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Object> getDeviceConfig()
        Returns the configuration for the associated device.
        Returns:
        The configuration for the associated device.

      • read

        void read()
        Reads device's value: Boolean, Number or String (can not be null).

        Controller has to invoke ::Listener:onChanged(...) method passing device's name. If there were a problem reading the value, it has to invoke ::Listener:onError(...) explaining the cause of the problem.

        Note: this method returns void because its implementation must be asynchronous.

        Parameters:
        deviceName - Device's name.

      • write

        void write​(java.lang.Object newValue)
        Changes ACTUATOR's value. Any valid Une data value: Boolean, Float or String (can not be null).

        If Controller was able to change the value, it has to invoke ::Listener:onChanged(...) method passing the ACTUATOR's name and value. Otherwise it has to invoke ::Listener:onError(...) explaining the cause of the problem.

        Note: only valid for ACTUATORs.
        Note: this method's implementation should be asynchronous.
        Note: if the execution of this method will take some time, it should run inside a thread.

        Parameters:
        actuatorName - ACTUATOR's name.
        newValue - Boolean, Float or String (can not be null).

      • start

        void start​(IRuntime rt)
        This method provides the Controller the opportunity access the IRuntime (in case it would be needed).Also provides the Controller the opportunity to perform any initialization tasks.
        Parameters:
        rt -

      • stop

        void stop()
        This method provides the Controller the opportunity to make some housekeeping before end running.
